titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Allan E. Goodman papers
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Dale Reed and Paige Minister

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-11T15:16-0800

change.item: Descriptions added for boxes 105-135, which included items removed from the vault; also biographical note was updated by Paige Minister.
revised to update encoding and add unitid by Elizabeth Phillips
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Allan E. Goodman Papers)//EN" "goodmaae.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 131 manuscript boxes, 2 card file boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 7 envelopes

did.abstract: Writings, reports, correspondence, clippings, notes, interviews, and printed matter, relating to the Vietnamese War, the Paris peace talks of 1968-1973, elections in South Vietnam from 1967 to 1971, the South Vietnamese legislature, migration to Saigon, urbanization and political and demographic change in Southeast Asia, counterinsurgency, and Soviet-American detente.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Users must sign a statement agreeing not to identify any persons mentioned in unpublished material in the collection (deceased U.S. citizens may be identified).
For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Allan E. Goodman papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1975 with several increments received periodically until 1996.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Consultant on Vietnamese Affairs, U.S. Department of State and RAND Corporation
M.P.A., John F. Kennedy School of Government, Harvard University
Professor of Government and International Relations and Department Chairman, Clark University
Editor, Indochina in Conflict: A Political Assessment (D.C., Heath, Lexington, Massachusetts)
Author, Politics in War: The Bases of Political Community in South Vietnam
National Fellow, Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace
Office of Political Research, Central Intelligence Agency
Author, The Lost Peace: America's Search for a Negotiated Settlement of the Vietnam War
Editor, Negotiating While Fighting: Diary of Admiral C.Turner Joy at the Korean Armistice Conference
President, CEO & Advisor at the Institute of International Education, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Writings, reports, correspondence, clippings, notes, interviews, and printed matter relating to the Vietnam War, the Paris peace talks of 1968-1973, elections in South Vietnam from 1967 to 1971, the South Vietnamese legislature, migration to Saigon, urbanization and political and demographic change in Southeast Asia, counterinsurgency, and Soviet-American detente.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports, notes, correspondence, and clippings, arranged alphabetically by subject. See also 1975 Increment and 1976-1996 Increments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, notes, and transcripts, arranged alphabetically by conference or seminar title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts, notes, data, correspondence, and printed copies of speeches and writings, arranged alphabetically by author and under author by title. See also 1975 Increment and 1976-1996 Increments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains petitions, books, pamphlets, periodicals, and other printed matter in Vietnamese. Also includes one item in Chinese and Vietnamese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Index card notes relating to South Vietnam, Thailand, and counterinsurgency. Arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains biographic data sheets, notes, clippings, and a manual from the Selective Service System related to Vietnamese legislators originally housed in binders. The titles that appeared on the binders have been preserved. Arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains additional subject files, speeches and writings, printed matter, and material in Vietnamese received between 1976 and 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes memoranda, reports, notes, correspondence, and clippings mainly related to Vietnam, arranged alphabetically according to Goodman's original folder titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of text in Vietnamese. Also included are two typescripts in English and handwritten notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains notes and correspondence to persons in New York relating to Negotiating While Fighting and a planning meeting on post-war reconstruction and assistance programs in Indochina that was to be held in New York, but was later cancelled.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains notes and correspondence to persons in Washington, D.C. mainly relating to Negotiating While Fighting and a planning meeting on post-war reconstruction and assistance programs in Indochina that was to be held in New York, but was later cancelled.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Goodman's handwritten notes regarding the Vietnam Negotiations. Most likely created in preparation for The Lost Peace: America's Search for a Negotiated Settlement of the Vietnam War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Includes some interfiled records determined by the government to be unclassified. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, notes, and portions of documents related to the current state of South Vietnam. Also included is a summary of an interview with a doctor from Gia Dinh Province about the current conditions in the area.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two sets of data related to Goodman's research on migration to Saigon and a poster.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Computer printouts of data used for a study entitled "The Dynamics of Migration to Saigon, 1964-1972," by Allan E. Goodman and Lawrence M. Franks.
